attributes.action: Reconsider changing bursaries to loans for Student Nurses and Midwives.
attributes.background: The government has recently voted to remove the NHS Bursary for Student Nurses and Midwives. Student Nurses and midwives work 37.5 per hours a week on placement, they should not have to pay for the privilege of becoming nurses, when they already work for that money!

attributes.action: Make it offence to film members of the emergency service for negative propaganda
attributes.background: There has been a recent increase in the number of cases via media channels (Facebook, YouTube) by members of the public recording Emergency Services, NHS and HM forces personnel, whilst causing harassment to provoke a reaction so the footage can be uploaded and used a negative propaganda.
attributes.additional_details: Propaganda is defined by Nelson (1996) as "a systematic form of purposeful persuasion that attempts to influence the emotions, attitudes, opinions, and actions of specified target audiences for ideological, political or commercial purposes through the controlled transmission of one-sided messages (which may or may not be factual) via mass and direct media channels.

attributes.action: Change the law to make the result of referendums in the UK legally binding.
attributes.background: Referendums held in the UK are not currently legally enforceable and parliament is under no duty to enact their results. MPs are elecred by the will of the people to represent the people, as such they must comply democratically with the demands of the people.
attributes.additional_details: From time to time UK Governments hold referendums. Regardless of the outcome, the government is under no legal obligation to accept the outcome. This is entirely undemocratic and must change.

attributes.action: Refuse admission of Mr Donald Trump to any crown property.
attributes.background: Mr Donald Trump, the property developer, plans to visit the UK. In response to his racist comments, this petition acknowledges his right to travel here but calls on the UK government not to permit him to set foot on crown property such as the Palace of Westminster or 10 Downing Street.
attributes.additional_details:
Republican and Democrat nominees have previously visited London ahead of US elections and been welcomed by successive governments.
In a campaign statement, Mr Trump advocated a "total and complete shutdown of Muslims entering the United States", a proposal the White House said was contrary to US values and its national security interests.
In his candidacy announcement Trump referred to Mexican immigrants to the US as rapists. 
He should not be afforded a platform in the halls of UK democracy.

attributes.action: The new British Ajax armoured fighting vehicles ALL to be built in the UK.
attributes.background: In a time when British industry, particularly the steel industry, is in crisis, it is abhorrent to patriotic British people that equipment intended for use by our service personnel is being built outside of our country and using materials that have not been supplied from our country

attributes.action: Make it illegal to pull out of selling a property once the sale had been agreed.
attributes.background: My wife and I are trying to buy our  first home. We have agreed to buy three different properties and the sellers ended up backing out on all three occasions. This is extremely upsetting and frustrating. This is not legal in other countries, so why should it be here? Home buyers should be protected.
attributes.additional_details:
Almost everyone we know who had bought a home had this happen at least once. This is a huge problem and unfair for those trying to buy a home. 

The seller can pull out of the sale at any time until contracts have been exchanged. The buyer can have spent lots of money before this and up losing hundreds, if not thousands,  of pounds. 

In Scotland, once a sale has been agreed, then the sellers must go ahead. 

The law on this country should be changed to save home buyers from this heartache.

attributes.action: Make Climate Change education a compulsory aspect of the UK national curriculum.
attributes.background: Climate change is arguably the most complex problem ever faced by humanity and the consequences of inaction will be most felt by our children. The fact that this information is not delivered in our schools with urgency is unacceptable and we are letting all future generations down!
attributes.additional_details:
How can we expect to encourage global collaboration and eco-innovation in the UK's future if our children are not even aware of this serious problem? Human induced climate change cannot be ignored any more. We are letting our children/country/planet down by not encouraging active debate on this issue in our schools. 
Current curricula: https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/national-curriculum. 
IPCC Climate Report: http://ipccwg2.gov/AR5/images/uploads/WG2AR5_SPM_FINAL.pdf

attributes.action: Call for a new General Election.
attributes.background: In light of the Conservative governments failure to reduce the national debt, the county feels they are not competent enough to lead our nation. Local councils are falling apart,  the NHS is in crisis,  the most vulnerable are being penalised while making financial gains to the top 1%!
attributes.additional_details:
According to the latest official figures, public debt has increased by £555 billion since 2010.

Public debt now stands at 89.4% of our national income (GDP), up from 78.4% when then the Tories came to power in 2010.

Every budget has seen a U turn and the house of Lords have time and time again blocked unfair measures being introduced.  Once the current Governnent get a result they don't like then they bully through the measures anyway. 

The nation's trust in this government has vanished.

attributes.action: Enforce the Disability Discrimination Act at government and local authorities
attributes.background: The Select Committee on Equality and Disability's report shows the government, and local authorities, are not enforcing the DDA.  We call on the government to enforce the Act, and tell local authorities they must enforce it, and produce an annual report to parliament on the steps they have taken.
attributes.additional_details:
The Select Committee on the Equality Act 2010 and Disability has produced a report: The Equality Act 2010: the impact on disabled people see http://bit.ly/DDAreport which points to serious problems with enforcement of the DDA including:
planning applications not being required to meet it,
Red tape unit ignoring needs of people with disabilities
Transport being inaccessible, and no enforcement of DDA
etc

attributes.action: Make it compulsory that all 18650 batteries come with care and safety  leaflets
attributes.background:
Due to the recent influx and high demand of more advanced, and powerful  electronic  cigarettes, 18650 batteries have become more in use to power these devices. 
I feel that people aren't either receiving the right safety guidance, or buying these online, and not knowing how dangerous they can be.
attributes.additional_details:
I want it to be compulsory that all 18650 batteries either bought, or shipped to the UK, come with a leaflet explaining the proper care and handling of these batteries. Giving a stronger and a better understanding of how dangerous they can be. Not just a simple 'warning' and a picture or two on the wraps of these batteries.
Some larger companies do not even have a warning sign on the batteries, and it is then left to vendors, or hope people have done their researched.

attributes.action: Make basic healthcare part of the curriculum in high schools.
attributes.background:
High school students across the UK should be receiving training for looking after their health.
Knowledge could save lives.
Imagine a future for our NHS with less strain on the system because people are trained to manage basic issues like fevers, understanding dosages, minor cuts and sickness.
attributes.additional_details:
A regular class on the curriculum could cover a lot of information, making a large difference. It could prevent patients showing up in A&E for a broken nail or hair extensions that got stuck (these are examples of actual cases). 
All of this could be prevented in future because they will have been educated to know how to deal with illness and minor injuries and when to see a doctor.
We can't predict the fate of the NHS, but we can prepare our children and teach them to use the NHS respectfully.

attributes.action: Provide food, shelter, rehabilitation and caring for every homeless person
attributes.background:
The homeless situation in Britain is a terrible stain on our home nations.  Having anybody living on the streets in such a developed society is deplorable.

To let it happen because it is felt that people have fell through the cracks, don't try or have chosen their misfortune is unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
It is estimated that as much as 25% of homeless people are ex service personal.

People in derived areas are doubly jeopardised by not having life chances of an affluent, structured, stable upbringing and are more susceptible to finding themselves on the fringes of society.

This is the age of one nation Britain and we need to care and nurture all.

We would like to see Parliament open up homeless rehabilitation centres to be able to accommodate everybody on the streets, to get their life back

attributes.action: Change the law so child sex offenders do not have contact with their children
attributes.background: Most children are protected by the law in areas that prevents child sex offenders having access to places where children are present . However children of sex offenders are not privy to the protection and given access to manipulators and grooming behaviour under supervision of unqualified people.
attributes.additional_details: If a child isn't a social services child , and the other parent poses no threat then social services will not supervise,or provide centres. As a result it forces the supervisor which may be a family member or ex partner, to have them into their homes or be witnessed by others associating with a known sex offender. This may put the child's safety at risk .If the supervisor isn't educated about grooming they may inadvertadly put the child at risk.Why are our children not worth adequate protection?

attributes.action: Make it illegal to direct hatred and abuse at any societal groups.
attributes.background: Racism and xenophobia have been legitimised in post-Brexit campaign Britain. We need to prevent extremist politicians, pressure groups and newspapers from inciting the hatred that has led to children being called 'vermin' and told to 'go home', and offensive slogans appearing in our cities.
attributes.additional_details: We would like Parliament to pass legislation making it illegal to target ANY group of people with hate messages, whether spoken, written or pictorial, so that politicians, pressure groups and newspapers can no longer use sensationalist headlines that scapegoat specific groups in society and make them a target for racism, xenophobia and other forms of hatred and abuse.

attributes.action: In a 2nd independence referendum, Scots living outside Scotland will get a vote
attributes.background: The recent referendum on EU membership may now precipitate a 2nd Scottish independence referendum.  If the Scottish Government takes this step, then it is reasonable that Scottish-born people currently living outside of Scotland have a vote in such a referendum.
attributes.additional_details: Scottish-born people, whether they are currently living in England or elsewhere, will be affected by the result of such a referendum, as it will have serious and life-changing implications for their future choice of nationality, citizenship and passport etc., both for themselves and for their descendants.

attributes.action: Make voting compulsory in elections and referendums, similar to Australian law.
attributes.background: Voters are obliged to vote in elections or attend a poling station, or log a postal vote, if they do not they could be subject to a penalty, such as fines or community service. Currently there are 22 countries, including Australia, that have this system.

attributes.action: an amendment to the Weights and Measures Act 1985 to allow Pound and Ounces.
attributes.background:
We the undersigned would like to be able to buy and sell goods in Pounds and Ounces. All it would take is a small amendment to the Weights and Measures Act 1985 to allow us to buy and sell goods in Pound and Ounces.  



This is a Zider Party campaign.
attributes.additional_details:
To sell goods in pounds and ounces was made illegally by the weights and measures Act 1985.

All we ask is for a small amendment to the Weight and Measures Act 1985 to allow us to use pounds and ounces to buy and sells goods.

attributes.action: Provides refuge in the UK for our armed forces interpreters in all war zones
attributes.background: I served for 30 years in the RAF, I completed my service for my country in 2005. To read that the country I served for, is hanging out to dry, even signing the death warrant of those brave local people, and their families who assisted our personnel in recent war zones deeply upsets me.
attributes.additional_details:
Trade                    Aircraft Avionics
Rank                     Chief Technician
Last Posting         RAF Cosford

attributes.action: To Issue National Identity Cards for everyone to protect our National Security.
attributes.background: With the ongoing threat to our borders and security, it is time to introduce a National Identity Card. This must be issued to all UK citizens and to all successful immigration applicants and should be carried at all times. This is a necessary step forward assist our Police and Immigration services.
attributes.additional_details: The refusal of the Government and the opposition of those who defend their privacy, are undermining the security and safety of the majority of people who wish to protect the UK and have nothing to hide!

attributes.action: Outlaw packaging materials unsuitable for recycling, such as foil-backed plastic
attributes.background: It is commonplace for manufacturing and retail to create hybrid packaging materials that are unsuitable for recycling.
attributes.additional_details:
An everyday example is the foil-backed plastic often used for crisp packets. Although plastic is now commonly accepted for recycling in household waste collection, crisp packets are not. The foil is bound to the plastic in a way that makes it impossible for our recycling processes to be used. 

In a world increasingly concerned about the environment, we need strict legislation ensuring all manufactured packaging materials are as recyclable as possible.

attributes.action: Make the parent receiving child maintenance provide receipts to remain eligible
attributes.background: Fathers and Mothers paying child maintenance should have proof that the money is being spent on their child/children and not funding the receiving parents social life or any other activities that do not directly benefit the children involved.
attributes.additional_details: My own personal case has seen me paying child maintenance for 4 years and I am yet to see any benefit it has had for my children. If by law the receiving parent had to provide receipts to show that the money received had been spent on the children and not on themselves then the majority of children in child maintenance cases would be better off as they would get 100% of the money spent on them.

attributes.action: National Lottery money should stay in the UK and be Not For Profit
attributes.background:
The National Lottery should be owned and regulated by the government or a Not for Profit company not owned by a Canadian company 

please read, copy and paste the link, please take this seriously...

https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/where-does-surplus-profit-go-nigel-gregory?trk=mp-author-card
attributes.additional_details:
The National Lottery should be owned and regulated by the government or a Not for Profit company regulated by the government and all surplus income should go to charitable causes in the UK. 

At the moment the ultimate owner is a Canadian Teachers Pension Fund who are receiving millions in shareholders funds paid for by people in the UK 

copy and paste the link, please take this seriously...

https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/where-does-surplus-profit-go-nigel-gregory?trk=mp-author-card

attributes.action: Debate MPs disrespect for the Speaker & leader of the opposition.
attributes.background: John Bercow's failure to call the House to order, during Government bench MP disorder during Jeremy Corbyn's contributions, calls into question MPs & Speaker's respect for behavioural responsibilities of MPs, evidenced in the video link: https://www.facebook.com/PigGateuk/videos/516561248515067/
attributes.additional_details:
The following links to media coverage, evidence the significant journalistic & public concern over MP behaviour & failed cognisance of acceptable conduct within the House, which compromise the Speaker's management of MPs who openly display disrespect within the House & in particular to the leader of the opposition & opposition MPs.

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/newsvideo/uk-politics-video/8636865/Order-How-Speaker-of-the-House-of-Commons-John-Bercow-fails-to-keep-control-of-the-children.html

attributes.action: Stop the Housing and Planning Bill change to social housing access for under 35s
attributes.background: Hidden in the Housing and Planning Bill is the proposal that benefit for social housing is changed so that those who are single aged under 35 will not be able to access an affordable social tenancy, they will be expected to share, including if they are vulnerable and/or in work or training.
attributes.additional_details: The Bill is likely to have a significant impact on single people under 35 since currently they are only eligible for the shared accommodation rate in the private sector. This will make difficult the letting of one bedroom social tenancies to single people under 35 who may be reliant on some form of housing benefit (including many of those in work). This is age discrimination and particularly unfair for vulnerable young people who cannot share accommodation due to mental health; autism, etc.

attributes.action: To make it it illegal to out LGBT people without their permission
attributes.background: As many sites are outing members of LGBT youths and adults without there permission and this can cause victims to get abuse and have problems at home.

attributes.action: Make assisted suicide for terminally ill patients legal
attributes.background:
As a veterinary surgeon I have euthansed many animals and consider it an honour and priviledge to have been able to end their suffering and give them a swift and painless end. 
At aged 47 I was diagnosed with breast cancer, and despite it being caught early 18 months later it is now terminal
attributes.additional_details:
The argument against assisted suicide seems to be that people could be coerced into taking their own lives. Frankly if other countries can put in measures to reduce this possibility, I cannot think it is beyond us. To die, at a time of ones choosing, painlessly and with loved ones around you is surely what we all wish for.
 My situation is far from unique and 1000's of people are condemoned 
to an end of pain and suffering which could so easily be avoided. Is this not what true compassion is?

attributes.action: Qualify MA (LPC with Business) for Postgraduate Student Finance funding.
attributes.background: Student Finance has recently announced that from 1 August 2016 it will be possible to apply for up to £10,000 funding to pay for the course and the living expenses.  Currently this does not include the Legal Practice Course with integrated  Masters.
attributes.additional_details: Students who cannot afford to pay for the course themselves do have the opportunity to complete their Legal Practice course. If Student Finance is available for Masters, then it should also be available for the other postgraduate courses which include Masters qualification.

attributes.action: Ban politicians from office who lie or deliberately/knowingly deceive the public
attributes.background: Recently there has been considerable deception on the part of politicians who appear to have deliberately deceived the British public on matters affecting the future well-being of the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: A politician shown to have seriously lied or deliberately or knowingly deceived the public on important matters of national interest should be barred from holding any ministerial post in government.

attributes.action: Instate the death penalty for all paedophiles.
attributes.background: The European Convention of Human Rights has interfered with the rights of British children to be protected from the most depraved individuals infesting our society. The death penalty should be instated against all pedophiles, as the ultimate deterrent and the ultimate protection for our children.
attributes.additional_details: Paedophilia, parallels genocide as one of the most vile acts committed against the most vulnerable. It is our duty to protect children from all levels of harm. The present legal system of a few years to life in prison for pedophiles, fails completely to protect children. The soft penalty of prison, does nothing to deter offenders and entices paedophiles released from prison to offend again, and again and again. Hanging paedophiles will make them think twice before harming children.

attributes.action: Allow U.K. expatriates to vote in the E.U. referendum
attributes.background:
Current law prevents expatriates who have been 'ordinarily non resident' - as defined by HMRC - from voting in any U.K. election.
This inspite of the fact that a vast majority are expatriates due to employment, family or health reasons. They are also required to submit U.K. tax returns.
attributes.additional_details: Incarcerated criminals are currently denied the vote in the U.K. Are expats classed as criminals?

attributes.action: Review Government plans to force all maintained schools to become academies.
attributes.background: In light of concerns expressed by Ofsted Chief Inspector, Sir Michael Wilshaw and chairman of the Local Government Association’s children and young people board, Councillor Roy Perry, is it right to push through this agenda so hastily?
attributes.additional_details:
In a recent Guardian article, Councillor Perry is quoted as saying that 82% of council-maintained schools are rated as good or outstanding by Ofsted and that 15% of the largest academy chains perform above the national average in terms of pupil progress, compared with 44% of council-run schools.

Guardian article: http://www.theguardian.com/education/2016/mar/15/every-english-school-to-become-an-academy-ministers-to-announce

Sir Michael Wilshaw expresses concerns about academy results and finances: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-35775458

attributes.action: Re-instate the death penalty
attributes.background: £105,000. That is how much money it costs to house a murderer for a year. That money is taxpayer's money. Your money. Not only this, but why would we want to keep evil people in the system anyway. Obviously, there are limits - mental illness, self-defence etc., but some people won't change.

attributes.action: Lower Abortion Stage from 24 Weeks to 12 Weeks, Due to babies being able to live
attributes.background: Lower the abortion stage from 24 weeks to under 16 wèeks as babies are born at 24 weeks and survived.

attributes.action: UK pensioners to receive a much higher State pension.
attributes.background:
We should not be means testing our elderly people for State handouts.

No old person should have to endure hypothermia related illness due to lack of heating. No old person should have to go hungry because of lack of food.
attributes.additional_details: Britain's State pension is less that £7,000 a year, even though this generation have paid Taxes and National Insurance contributions all, their working lives.

attributes.action: The EU flag be flown from parliament on alternate days with the Union Flag.
attributes.background: This petition grows out of national frustration with the referendum, and at how various governments, over the decades, have failed to promote the benefits of the EU to the public at large.
attributes.additional_details:
Flags are matters of high symbolic importance. In most EU member states, the EU flag is routinely flown alongside the national flag. This practice should have been instituted in the UK long ago. 
The most prominent flagstaff in the land is that on Parliament itself. For practical reasons it may not be possible to hoist two, thus the proposal is for flying the UK and EU flags on alternate days.

attributes.action: Work permit for Indian restaurant skilled staff crisis
attributes.background: The Indian restaurant trade is dying due to lack of staff we need the government to help us bring skilled staff to restaurant trade to survive. Look at introducing work permits again
attributes.additional_details: Limit the amount of work permit per restaurant to limit abuse

attributes.action: Create an Independent Body to report on the accuracy of MPs' public statements.
attributes.background: The EU referendum highlighted the damage that can be caused by false & misleading information. We the undersigned propose that an independent panel should be established to report to the public on the validity and accuracy of MPs' public comments.
attributes.additional_details: At the heart of democracy is clear information sharing & communication. MPs should therefore be held to account for the validity of information they share. We advise that the Independent Panel will assess MPs' comments upon request from the public. Each comment could be assessed as to whether it is factually correct/incorrect, verifiable/unverifiable, or misleadingly presented. There could be sanctions for repeat offenders of misleading information & an 'honesty' league table of MPs.

attributes.action: Stop making cuts to the NHS mental health service.
attributes.background:
More people have started suffering from mental health issues.
The majority are desperate for help, but when they reach out there is nothing there.
Suicide rates are increasing due to thinking there is no hope.
If the NHS keeps cutting funding for mental health support this will just get worse.

attributes.action: Include Feminism as part of the primary and/or secondary school curriculum.
attributes.background: As a female sixth form student, I have come across few male peers who fully understand feminism. Many refuse to accept that gender inequality is still an issue both nationally and globally, and see feminists as man-hating groups advocating female superiority. This ignorance must be addressed.
attributes.additional_details: If people were made aware and given a full understanding of Feminism and gender inequality from a young age, they would be far more tuned in to these issues in adult life. This would be effective in helping society to become more equal and tolerant in terms of gender, which would benefit everyone, including men. The main factor inhibiting the achievement of gender equality appears to be a general ignorance of the fact that inequality exists. The way to address this ignorance is education.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to smoke in front of children, or in rooms which they use
attributes.background: Adults who smoke in front of children, especially inside a house are neglecting the health of that child. Smoke also hangs around on furniture / walls / curtains, making it an unhealthy environment for the child. Smoking in front of a child should be illegal and deemed as child neglect

attributes.action: Replace BSL (breed specific law) with blanket legislation applying to all dogs.
attributes.background:
BSL permits unfair treatment of certain dog breeds based on stereotypes. This should be replaced with a blanket legislation applying to all dogs regardless of breed.

The current legislation also falsely suggests that all dogs not of specific breeds must be friendly, which is not always the case.

attributes.action: Pay volunteer carers the national minimum wage with full employment rights.
attributes.background:
Official figures have estimated that unpaid carers save the government £162 bn per yr. The cost of a local authority providing the same level of in home care is avrg £17.20 per hr.
The threshold for someone claiming carers allowance is a min of 35hrs per week @ £62,10 that is £1.77p per hr !
attributes.additional_details: Many carers have to give up jobs and careers in order to do a job that the local authority should be doing and get little or no thanks and support. Full time carers should be at least entitled to the minimum wage and statutory holidays with replacement care provided by local authorities. Anything less than this is just slave labour with the government taking unfair advantage of an unrecognized, unapreciated and valuable work force that, last year, paid for the NHS budget

attributes.action: Make it law that all vehicles have to be fitted with a lifehammer.
attributes.background: After hearing the awful tragedy of the family who lost their lives as their car went off the pier in Buncrana, it stresses the importance a lifehammer or emergency hammer could have on saving lives. They cost barely anything. They break the glass windows in emergencies allowing people to escape.
attributes.additional_details: Many vehicles already have life hammers fitted Including Buses and plant machinery. But cars do not. Lifehammers or emergency hammers could save lives. Car window glass is almost impossible to break with just human force alone, especially when you only have a limited time to do it. So please help to make having a lifehammer or emergency hammer in your vehicle a law. It really could save lives.

attributes.action: A vote of no confidence in the Government over it's Education policies.
attributes.background:
I would like a vote of no confidence in the Government's Education policies. There is now a crisis in teaching. Too many teachers are leaving the profession and the children and young people of our country are being let down by narrow minded Tories. 
They are failing children, parents and Britain.
attributes.additional_details:
Our children are being failed by the Tory government. 
Students are being forced to do the Ebacc and have their choices limited as a result of the narrowing of the curriculum.
Schools are being forced to be Academies which statistics prove are no better than when we had LEA schools. 
Schools need money to implement new changes and syllabuses yet are given no extra money. What's worse is that leaders of Academy Chains are paid ridiculous sums. Sir Daniel Moynihan takes over £13,000 per Academy!

attributes.action: Re-instate Hard Shoulders on ALL Motorways and Scrap the Smart Motorway
attributes.background: The removal of the Hard Shoulder has made it more dangerous to all users of the motorway. It is not possible to get to the next refuge if the car has lost power. At night or in fog there is no possibility to warn others following of the danger & recovering a vehicle is now more dangerous.
attributes.additional_details:
Tuesday 11 December 1984: A serious multiple Road Traffic Accident on the M25 near Clacket Lane, Kent; nine people were killed and ten injured.
One of the worst multiple vehicle accidents happened on the M25, where the hard shoulder has now been removed. Twenty-six vehicles and thirty one drivers and passengers were involved. The accident happened in dense fog, which seemed to have descended suddenly and nine people died in the subsequent accident.

attributes.action: Make it law for all horse riders to wear hi-viz clothing when riding on the road
attributes.background:
As a horse rider, nothing infuriates me more than other riders who risk themselves and their horses by hacking on roads not wearing hi-viz. 
We expect drivers and other road users to slow down when passing us so we should make sure we can be seen well in advance.
attributes.additional_details:
Wearing hi-viz increases visibility by seconds. 
By not wearing it riders increase the risk of accident.

Be safe, be seen!

attributes.action: Require that all new build properties be fitted with solar PV panels at build.
attributes.background: Solar (PV) power as an important and easily achieved form of renewable energy. PV panels fitted at build keeps costs low, helping to reduce the need for large power generation such as at Hinkley Point. New battery storage systems mean this power would be available even after sundown.

attributes.action: Replace religious education in UK schools with a comparative history of religion
attributes.background: Religion can be the cause of social and educational schism.
attributes.additional_details: School is our first experience of institutional life and so, as a priority, it should be inclusive and harmonised from the outset. Religion is used in our schools as a context to teach ethics. A Comparative History of Religion will foster objectivity and tolerance, which are themselves virtuous. A Comparative History of Religion will produce an empirical lesson in social harmony that is psychologically wholesome, undeniable and therefore enduring.

attributes.action: Stop children convicted of serious offences from attending mainstream schools
attributes.background: The current legislative framework MUST be reviewed to ensure those committing the most serious offences such as stabbing another child cannot return to mainstream school, putting the safety of children & teachers at risk
attributes.additional_details: There MUST be a minimum period of monitoring and psychological assessment within a specialist unit before offenders are reintegrated, irrespective of the number of previous exclusions a child has.  Disruptive behaviour currently carries the same punishment as stabbing.

attributes.action: Tax breaks for Arts subject tuition, for school age children.
attributes.background: Arts education for young people continues to be subject to yearly cuts. Arts tuition outside of school education is costly, but now necessary to provide sufficient learning opportunities for talented children. This is inaccessible to many families. Help end the elitism and value the arts.
attributes.additional_details:
UK government prioritises "core" subjects (Maths, English, Sciences, Language, History Geography) by way of the EBacc performance measure: http://bit.ly/1QiubcJ  Whereas these subjects should be valued, it's at the expense of arts subjects. 

What is being asked here is a small contribution to arts education, that would actually help boost the economy at the same time. The Warwick Commission estimates the arts sector represents 5% of the British economy valued at £76.9bn: http://bit.ly/1EJWbkV
